verse:
श्वोभावा मर्त्यस्य यदन्तकैतत्सर्वेन्द्रियाणां जरयन्ति तेजः।
अपि सर्वं जीवितमल्पमेव तवैव वाहास्तव नृत्यगीते ॥

terms.श्वोभावा मर्त्यस्य यदन्तकैतत्: The nature of mortals is to deteriorate eventually
terms.सर्वेन्द्रियाणां जरयन्ति तेजः: The energy of all senses wanes
terms.अपि सर्वं जीवितमल्पमेव: Even the entire life is short-lived
terms.तवैव वाहास्तव नृत्यगीते: Only your dance and song endure

meaning: This verse highlights the transient and ephemeral nature of human existence. It states that mortals are bound to deteriorate eventually, and the energy of all senses diminishes over time. It further emphasizes that even the entirety of a person's life is short lived. However, amidst the impermanence, it asserts that only your dance and song endure indefinitely. This can be interpreted metaphorically, implying the lasting impact and significance of one's artistic expressions and creative contributions.

upanishad-org.meaning: Until the morrow mortal man has these things, O Ender, and they wear away all this keenness and glory of his senses; nay, all life is even for a little. Thine are these chariots and thine the dancing of these women and their singing
